Package io.github.ai4ci.abm

Interface TestResult

All Superinterfaces:
Serializable
@Immutable public interface TestResult extends Serializable
Models a testing process and its outcome for an individual in the simulation. This immutable value object captures the details of a single test event, including the true viral load at the time of testing, the type of test administered, and the observed result after accounting for test parameters like sensitivity, specificity, and delay. Instances of this class are typically generated by the simulation engine when a Person undergoes testing. This class is Serializable for persistence across simulation runs.

    TestResult.Indication
    Defines the indication for which a test was performed.
    static enum 
    TestResult.Result
    Represents the possible outcomes of a test.
    static enum 
    TestResult.Type
    Defines the types of tests available in the simulation, each with its specific parameters.

  • Method Details

    • defaultTypes

      static ShallowList<TestParameters> defaultTypes()
      Provides a ShallowList of default TestParameters for all defined TestResult.Types. This is useful for initializing the set of available tests in the simulation configuration.
      Returns:
      A ShallowList containing the default parameters for each test type.

    • resultFrom

      static Optional<TestResult> resultFrom(PersonTemporalState testee, TestResult.Type type)
      Creates an Optional TestResult for a given PersonTemporalState and TestResult.Type. This factory method is used by the simulation to generate new test results. It retrieves the ExecutionConfiguration from the person's Outbreak, uses the person's current viral load and current time, and the specified TestResult.Type to build a new TestResult with a TestResult.Indication.REACTIVE indication.
      Parameters:
      testee - The PersonTemporalState of the individual being tested.
      type - The TestResult.Type of test to be performed.
      Returns:
      An Optional containing the new TestResult, or empty if the test type is not found.

    • screeningResultFrom

      static Optional<TestResult> screeningResultFrom(PersonTemporalState testee, TestResult.Type type)
      Creates an Optional TestResult for a screening test, similar to resultFrom(PersonTemporalState, Type). This method specifically sets the TestResult.Indication to TestResult.Indication.SCREENING.
      Parameters:
      testee - The PersonTemporalState of the individual being screened.
      type - The TestResult.Type of screening test to be performed.
      Returns:
      An Optional containing the new screening TestResult, or empty if the test type is not found.

    • getDelay

      @Derived default long getDelay()
      Calculates the delay in days until the test result is available. This delay is sampled from a log-normal distribution using the mean and standard deviation specified in TestParameters.getMeanTestDelay() and TestParameters.getSdTestDelay(). A Sampler is used to introduce stochasticity in the delay.
      Returns:
      The test delay in days as a long.

    • getFinalObservedResult

      @Derived default boolean getFinalObservedResult()
      Determines the final observed result of the test based on the sampled viral load and the test's limit of detection. If the sampled viral load is greater than the limit of detection, the result is considered positive.
      Returns:
      true if the final observed result is positive, false otherwise.

    • getFinalResult

      default TestResult.Result getFinalResult()
      Returns the final TestResult.Result of the test (either TestResult.Result.POSITIVE or TestResult.Result.NEGATIVE). This is directly derived from getFinalObservedResult().
      Returns:
      The final TestResult.Result of the test.

    • getIndication

      TestResult.Indication getIndication()
      Returns the TestResult.Indication for which this test was performed (e.g., REACTIVE or SCREENING).
      Returns:
      The TestResult.Indication of the test.

    • getResultTime

      default long getResultTime()
      Calculates the estimated time (day) when the test result will become available. This is determined by adding the test delay to the sampling time.
      Returns:
      The estimated result availability time as a long.

    • getTestParams

      TestParameters getTestParams()
      Returns the TestParameters that define the characteristics of this specific test. These parameters include sensitivity, specificity, and delay, which influence the observed test result.
      Returns:
      The TestParameters for this test.

    • getTime

      long getTime()
      Returns the simulation time (day) when the test was sampled.
      Returns:
      The time of test sampling as a long.

    • getViralLoadSample

      @Derived default double getViralLoadSample()
      Calculates and returns the observed viral load sample, which incorporates noise based on the test's characteristics. This value is derived from getViralLoadTruth() by applying a noise model defined in TestParameters.applyNoise(double, Sampler). The noise simulates the variability and imperfections of real-world testing.
      Returns:
      The sampled viral load as a double.

    • getViralLoadTruth

      double getViralLoadTruth()
      Returns the true viral load of the person at the time the test was sampled. This value represents the actual biological state, independent of test performance.
      Returns:
      The true viral load as a double.

    • isResultAvailable

      default boolean isResultAvailable(int day)
      Checks if the test result is available by the specified day. This is true if the day is greater than or equal to the result availability time.
      Parameters:
      day - The current simulation day to check against.
      Returns:
      true if the result is available by this day, false otherwise.

    • isResultCurrent

      default boolean isResultCurrent(long day, long recoveryTime)
      Checks if the test result is considered current on a given day within a recoveryTime window. A result is current if the day is on or after the test sampling time and before getTime() + recoveryTime.
      Parameters:
      day - The current simulation day.
      recoveryTime - The duration for which the test result remains relevant.
      Returns:
      true if the result is current, false otherwise.

    • isResultToday

      default boolean isResultToday(int day)
      Checks if the test result becomes available on the specified day. This is true if the day matches the result availability time.
      Parameters:
      day - The current simulation day to check against.
      Returns:
      true if the result is available today, false otherwise.

    • logLikelihoodRatio

      default double logLikelihoodRatio(int delay)
      The log likelihood ratio delay days after the test was taken. If the actual test delay is greater than the provided delay, a value of 0 is returned, meaning the result is not yet available at that point. Otherwise, trueLogLikelihoodRatio() is returned.
      Parameters:
      delay - The number of days after the test was taken.
      Returns:
      The log-likelihood ratio at the specified delay.

    • logLikelihoodRatio

      default double logLikelihoodRatio(int day, int limit)
      Returns the log-likelihood ratio for the test result, considering its relevance within a specified time window. If the result is considered current (i.e., isResultCurrent(long, long) returns true for the given day and recovery time), then trueLogLikelihoodRatio() is returned. Otherwise, a value of 0 is returned, indicating no current evidential impact.
      Parameters:
      day - The current simulation day.
      limit - The recovery time or duration for which the test result remains current.
      Returns:
      The log-likelihood ratio for the specified day and limit.

    • resultOnDay

      default TestResult.Result resultOnDay(int day)
      Returns the TestResult.Result of the test on a given day. If the result is not yet available (isResultAvailable(int) is false), it returns TestResult.Result.PENDING. Otherwise, it returns TestResult.Result.POSITIVE or TestResult.Result.NEGATIVE based on getFinalObservedResult().
      Parameters:
      day - The current simulation day.
      Returns:
      The TestResult.Result of the test for the specified day.

    • trueLogLikelihoodRatio

      @Derived default double trueLogLikelihoodRatio()
      Calculates the true log-likelihood ratio for this test result. This ratio quantifies the change in the odds of infection given the observed test result. It is calculated based on whether the final observed result is positive or negative, using TestParameters.positiveLikelihoodRatio() or TestParameters.negativeLikelihoodRatio().
      Returns:
      The true log-likelihood ratio as a double.
